Crimes.Crime_Name: Breach of Conditions of Permanent Residency Leading to Deportation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does exclusion from automatic citizenship violate Charter rights under sections 7, 12, or 15?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Citizenship Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant born in Poland to Polish parents, arrived in Canada at age six as permanent resident, denied citizenship due to legislative omission, later deported after criminal convictions
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of citizenship denial and deportation order
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident, foreign-born child arriving before age seven
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Criminal conduct post-residency leading to deportation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged discrimination based on birthplace and parental nationality under the Citizenship Act
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Charter scrutiny of legislation for breaches of sections 7 (liberty/security), 12 (cruel treatment), and 15 (equality)
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Distinction based on age at entry not found discriminatory; deportation linked to personal criminal behavior
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Citizenship Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to statutory interpretation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Statutory provisions, applicant’s immigration and criminal record
Crimes.Application_Basis: Legislative exclusion of children under seven from automatic citizenship
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Recognition of citizenship and halt to deportation
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Citizenship is defined by statute and subject to Charter review if discriminatory
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None identified – applicant failed to meet burden on Charter claim
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Deportation resulted from criminal conduct, not status-based harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Challenge to Citizenship Act's exclusion of certain permanent resident children from automatic citizenship
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Official records of immigration and criminal history used
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No disputes over authenticity or admissibility
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Initial compliance with residency conditions, later breached due to criminality
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act, s.3(1) and related provisions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over citizenship and immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Court relied on documented criminal record and statutory framework
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Deportation attributable to criminal actions, not discriminatory law
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Section 15 equality analysis; minimal impairment under section 1 justification not required due to no breach

Crimes.Crime_Name: Being a Danger to the Public under Immigration Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Public safety risk due to criminal behavior
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does exclusion from citizenship under Citizenship Act violate Charter sections 7, 12, or 15?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Citizenship Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant born in Poland, arrived in Canada at age six, denied citizenship due to statutory exclusion, later convicted of crimes and deemed danger to public
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of citizenship denial and deportation
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign-born permanent resident minor upon arrival
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Engaged in criminal activity rendering him inadmissible and dangerous to public
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that Citizenship Act discriminates against children arriving before age seven
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Charter protections under s.7 (life/liberty), s.12 (cruel treatment), s.15 (equality)
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Status-based distinction not inherently discriminatory; outcome driven by conduct
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of immigration and citizenship decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Immigration file, criminal record, statutory text
Crimes.Application_Basis: Failure to acquire citizenship due to age-based exclusion in Citizenship Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Criminal history and failure to naturalize despite eligibility pathways
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Declaration of citizenship and stay of removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Parliament has authority to set citizenship criteria; such laws must comply with Charter
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No deficiency – applicant did not prove systemic discrimination
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk to public justified removal; harm not from legislation but individual conduct
Crimes.Cause_Description: Constitutional challenge to Citizenship Act’s exclusion of young permanent residents from automatic citizenship
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Initially compliant, later violated through criminal acts
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act s.3(1), IRPA s.34 (danger to public)
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal authority over immigration and citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Deportation grounded in criminality, not origin or status
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Section 15 equality analysis; no adverse impact discrimination proven

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Charter challenge to citizenship denial following criminal conviction
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Citizenship Act, Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, IRPA
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Right to fair hearing in citizenship and deportation proceedings
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Presumed full disclosure in judicial review context
Crimes.Authority_Responsible: Immigration Division, Citizenship Commission, Minister of IRCC
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act s.3(1), CDSA s.5, IRPA s.36 (inadmissibility for serious crime)
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and gravity of narcotics offense, link to public safety
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Opportunity to respond to allegations prior to removal
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Serious criminality posing threat to Canadian society
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness in administrative review
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Police reports, court records, immigration files
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Conviction for narcotics trafficking leading to inadmissibility
Crimes.Charter_Issues: Alleged violations of s.7, s.12, s.15 due to citizenship exclusion
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence: conviction record, sentencing documents
Crimes.Risk_Assessment_Factors: Scale of drug operation, recidivism, community harm
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and scope of judicial review

Crimes.Applicant_Status: Permanent resident at time of offense
